analysis: The documents primarily concern the allocation of funds and establishment of agencies during the Great Depression and related periods, often under emergency relief acts. They cover a range of initiatives, including conservation work, public works, rural electrification, and assistance to Puerto Rico. Many documents reference specific acts of Congress and executive orders, amending or extending previous directives. A common theme is addressing unemployment and economic hardship through government programs.
title: Great Depression Era Fund Allocations and Agency Creation
